results.title: I Can't See
results.brief_description: Eye protection is often one of the most important features in a company’s safety program.. Clearly designated areas, regulations and warnings are not always observed, with the result that many employees put themselves at risk of injury to one of the most vital senses. “I Can’t See” is a powerful film which rejects the attitude of some employees that eye protection is a nuisance its need overstated, the “won’t happen to me” attitude. At the same time, we see it being used correctly in several different industrial situations.

results.title: I can't hear
results.creator_credit: Peter Griffiths, Millbank Films and Peter Rawson
results.brief_description: Arthur Freeman is a wood machinist in a medium sized industrial firm. Over the years he has, whenever possible, dodged the wearing of ear protection. He is now suffering from noise induced hearing loss. A fictionalised drama.

results.title: I Call It Murder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”. Broadcast U.K. November 1979
The results of drastic cuts in America’s health services are seen in the greatly reduced availability of free hospital treatment. Looks at the situation in a Chicago hospital serving the ghetto areas, which faces closure

results.title: I Call It Home
results.brief_description: This program examines the homelessness in Melbourne with a specific focus on a Government redevelopment plan to provide improved sheltering services for single men. Councillors, welfare workers and the men themselves, discuss the reality of the system and what the Government plan will provide.

results.title: I am what I know
results.creator_credit: Glenda Fillinger, Paul Fillinger and Churchill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Encourages a positive attitude towards what we do know and towards attaining new knowledge. Children’s comments and songs are used to explain that different people know different things. Illustrates ways to feel better about one’s attainments. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: I am trying to break your heart: a film about Wilco
results.creator_credit: Cowboy Pictures, Experience Music Project, Fusionfilms, Plexifilm, Peter Abraham and Sam Jones
results.brief_description: In 2000 New York based rock band Wilco embarked upon the recording of their fifth studio album. With money from their record label, the band decided to self-produce “Yankee Hotel Foxtrot” - their most collaborative effort to date. Filmmaker Sam Jones recorded the process in what would prove an eventful year for the band, marked by frustration with the recording, personality clashes and issues with label executives. The film focuses chiefly on lead singer and songwriter Jeff Tweedy, a man driven by the urge to create, write and produce music who is at times perplexed by the vagaries of the music industry and the demands placed upon him as the face of Wilco. Shooting on 16mm, in black and white, with a hand-held camera, Jones creates a document that apes the successful look and feel of “Don’t look back” (1967) D. A. Pennebaker’s legendary examination of Bob Dylan on tour and in the spotlight at a crucial time of his career. Whilst Jones’ work cannot claim the same iconic status, his documentary is also an intimate, personal view of an artist at odds with the current traits of the American music business, with his fellow musicians and at times, with himself. Features footage of live performances, studio work and interviews with Wilco and various colleagues.
results.title_for_label: I am trying to break your heart: a film about Wilco

results.title: I am Joe's spine
results.brief_description: Uses three-dimensional animation and live sequences to provide an understanding of the complexity of the spine’s construction and an awareness of what can happen when the spine and its surrounding muscles are not given proper care.

results.title: I am Joe's heart. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to show the effects of lack of exercise, heavy smoking, and overindulgence in fatty foods and alcohol on the heart. Shows how the heart and circulatory system function and stresses exercise and healthful living.
